Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the significance of the number of African-Americans shot dead by police in comparison to whites.
Understate: The claim may be understating the number of whites killed by police in comparison to African-Americans.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient support or evidence to back up the numbers stated.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the numbers provided accurately represent the true extent of police killings and that they reflect a trend of white police officers shooting black youths.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations or factors that contribute to the differences in the numbers of African-Americans and whites killed by police, which are not addressed in the claim.
